ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Mask of Deception and XP Penalties
ygData.msgSnippet: According what I read by abashi, xp is NOT divided equally,  If you are grouped, the hybrid takes more xp from the pool,. So all this Hybrid xp penality is
ygData.messageBody:
According what I read by abashi, xp is NOT divided equally, If you are
grouped, the hybrid takes more xp from the pool,.
So all this Hybrid xp penality is crap, You level just as fast as someone
with a penality. It only effects solo. Which brings up,
why even be a human?

Paul

-----Original Message-----
From: Reece, Tom CPT- 25IDL G4 [mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
Sent: Tuesday, June 13, 2000 12:41 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Mask of Deception and XP Penalties


I should have included a caveat in my reply. At the time the enchanter I
grouped with mentioned getting more EXP as a human instead of a high elf,
the ShowEQ program was not around. Any theories on EXP gain were just
guesses. The enchanter community assumed they got more EXP as humans. Now
that ShowEQ has shown how EXP is split we know that their assumption was
incorrect.

Galtin of E'ci
-----Original Message-----
From: Reeves, Patrick W [mailto:pwr3@...]
Sent: Tuesday, June 13, 2000 4:01 AM
To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Mask of Deception and XP Penalties


This is a load of hoey. Exp is divided amoungs the party based on the total
exp in the party. The so called 'experience penalty' for hybrid and
non-halflings is not applied to exp as you recieve it is merely the amount
of experience you need for the next level. So if a Troll SK or a Halfling
Druid kill a mob they both get the EXACT same amount of experience. It may
register different on the experience bar, but that is a function of the
Druid need fewer experience points to level. Not a muliplier to the exp
they just recieved.

Rokenn

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Reece, Tom CPT- 25IDL G4
> [mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
> Sent: Monday, June 12, 2000 1:02 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Mask of Deception and XP Penalties
>
>
> I used to group quite a bit with an enchanter friend. He was
> a high elf but
> would almost always have the human illusion up. He said that
> the reason for
> this is that he would get more EXP as a human instead of a high elf.
> Supposedly this was common knowledge among the enchanter
> community. Now I
> don't know for certain if this is a fact or not, but if it is
> true, then it
> would be a safe assumption that bards with a DE illusion
> would get the same
> EXP modifier as true DEs.
>
> Galtin of E'ci
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: jhenders@... [mailto:jhenders@...]
> Sent: Sunday, June 11, 2000 2:59 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Mask of Deception and XP Penalties
>
>
> I've been told that ShowEQ shows that when you are using the guise
> illusion dark elf your exp table gets changed to dark elf, so I guess
> it's possible, though I haven't heard of it being tested yet.
> All bards
> seem to get the same exp penalty regardless of race so I don't know if
> you would get a change or not. When I heard the issue discussed it was
> from testing a warrior with the pre-patch guise so the exp difference
> would matter.
>
> I wonder if a troll sk who used the old guise would actually need less
> exp.
>
> On Sun, Jun 11/00, Stephen Quarterman <steveq@...> wrote:
> > While wandering around the Lake of Ill Omen zone I was
> approaced by a
> person
> > who goes by the name of Wabs. This person told me, and apparently
> another
> > bard, that wearing the Mask of Deception and having it
> activated caused a
> > substantially large XP Penalty. He stated something like a
> 30% penalty.
> > Now, I have looked over all the bard sites and been reading
> here for quite
> > some time and never seen mention of this. The other bard
> that I talked to
> > said he had searched the rogue sites with no info found.
> Has anyone here
> > seen or heard of this penalty?
>
> --
